title: (x) Bob Guiney - Ogra (customized) {David Hubner}
content:
![bob guiney banner for font id](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22434.jpg)   
   
Any ideas on this one?   
   
Thanks in advance,   
   
-Dave
author: dave9921

comments.content: The bits below is Handel Gothic and the ones above are taunting me.

Hmm, The top one looks just like ' [Ogra](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436/http:/www.closefonts.com/01.html)', by [Simon Schmidt / CloseFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436/http:/www.closefonts.com/), somehow..   
( [www.closefonts.com/01.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436/http:/www.closefonts.com/01.html) ) / ( [www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ogra.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ogra.asp) )

Nicely done, David! [Here's a link](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ogra_obl.asp) to Ogra on Fountain's site. The I is different, but that wouldn't be too hard to pull off.

Bravo, type heads! Thanks for the ID.   
   
-Dave

Thank you..   
   
I love ( nearly ) everything, ever released on / from Fountain, so maybe thats why.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123436im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
( 'Ograbic', the 'fakearabichandwriting' version of Ogra, and 'UniF were some of the first typefaces, bought, just for myself, from Fountain, years ago.. )   
So, Thanks to Mr. Bruhn and to the Fountain related type designers..
